column5: Do any of you luremaking type guys have a source for stainless diving lips [muskie bait size]? I was talking to Real Pro Luremaking today-they don't have them and can't get them-in fact she asked that if I found a source for them to let her know. Any help would be greatly appreciated as I have several lures just sitting there waiting for lips. THANKS!!!
luremaking.com had them last time I ordered from them, but I buy sheets of Lexan and cut my own now.  moores lures or stamina should have them.

They have to be made if you are thinking of 10"plus lures. If you have a design. A metal Fabrication shop could help you out. That's what I did. An order of 50 to 100  will keep you going for a while,,,cost is still cheaper than buyin them..... AND more satisfying.
If only the "Original" Jumlas were still available, the Tammy Faye Baker model had interchangable lips!!!... and would suck the moss off of a submerged boulder in 50 F.O.W!!!
rolly and helens has some as well
This is one of the baits that Robin makes with the large stainless lips, and I'm certain he get's them from luremaking.com

http://www.luremaking.com/catalogue/catalo...diving_lips.htm http://www.luremaking.com/catalogue/catalo...diving_lips.htm If you want to cut your own lexan ones: http://www.luremaking.com/catalogue/downlo...nkbait_lips.pdf
Lew: Those are the lips I'm looking for but LureMaking hasn't got any and can't get them. Thanks anyway for the help!

luremaking.com ran out of them and their supplier has gone out of business a while ago, this company has got a munfacturing company to make a new die and is expecting and order of the number 7 muskie bills on order and should be in by the end of January, give them a shout, I have had an order in since november, the guys name is Paul Haarstad, have fun boston.  http://www.upnorthoutdoors.com/stamina/  edit to add link to the bills them selves. cheers  http://www.upnorthoutdoors.com/stamina/plu...plug_bills.html
